intro: Microlicia insignioides, commonly known as the slender microlicia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, palmate leaves. It produces showy, yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
